intro: Cyanea pulchra, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and somewhat woody. Cyanea pulchra is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is considered a rare and endangered species.
